snippet: Mr. Seedman was the New York Police Department’s chief of detectives for only 13 months, but he helped modernize and restructure the way detectives and patrol officers did their jobs.
abstract: Albert Seedman, New York Police Department’s chief of detectives in early 1970s, dies at age 94.

byline.contributor: Al Baker and Jack Kadden contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Seedman was the New York Police Department’s chief of detectives for only 13 months, but he helped modernize and restructure the way detectives and patrol officers did their jobs.

headline.seo: Albert Seedman, Former Chief of Detectives in New York, Dies at 94
headline.main: Albert Seedman, Chief of Detectives in New York for Short, Tumultuous Time, Dies at 94
headline.print_headline: Albert Seedman, 94, Chief of Detectives In New York for Short, Tumultuous Time
